bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 18, 1940

div1.p: Hench discusses plans to finance and erect a memorial at the site of Camp Lazear. He describes it as a place where Finlay's concept was proven correct by the work of the U.S. Army. Hench includes sketches of the site.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 18, 1940
div1.p:
I am at home without a
secretary & want to write you tonight, but as I want to keep a
copy as a memorandum I am taking the liberty of writing it
on pencil. I have been so busy the past 2 weeks I don't know
what I've written whom & dont know how much I've told you of
our more recent investigations- I should say, those of Moran &
Pogolotti although I have been in it all & in correspondence with
Moran practically day of annail. I think I told you that
when we first visited Mrs Rojas I asked her if she recalled any
contract, paper etc she might have seen written from or to Dr
Reed of her husband but she said no. Mrs I sent her my long
memorandum apparent the panel got inspired & started hunting
around - found the day books just 2 weeks ago & learned that
contrary to them on grand recollection the 2 buildings were Not
to be destroyed but to be “delivered to the original owner & leasee.”
Well that leant authority to what a Mr 2 ungunagui had
told us about a shock which Moros & I first tried to
visualize as either Bldg 1 or 2 but we decided against it
for various reasons (See my memorandum). But with this
depute evidence Moran & Pogolotti re-opened then
search & concluded that the shock we'd looked over was
Bldg #1 altered of having at that time 3 lean-too's
attached to it. I have so wanted to behave it but felt
that I had the critical so have been firing questions
& demanding certain special investigations. They've done
then all (fine fellows, those!) and after examining
the day book records (which came yesterday) I've
convinced myself. The last possible conflict I think was
ironed out just this afternoon. They found the bldg.
facing the right way, the right size etc, with “tonghed
& groved boards”, as Reed said. There was only one
hetch- Agramonte's drawings of the bldg (& I dont know
(2
whether the drawing was made from memory in 1915 when the paper
appeared or was copied from an original authentic one made
STOVE
in 1900) shows a stove on the right as one enters the
bldg. In our bldg there was a hole (long unused) for
a stove pipe but it was on the left side. I wrote Dr
Cooke & have just heard from him this afternoon He
said that despite Agramontes' drawing he (Cooke)
remember it as having been on the left! So (altho I will not be
finally convinced until I can examine it myself this spring-
I will go down again) there seems little doubt about it.
At least I have already taken steps to purchase it for
immediate protection. Even since I was there they have
torn down one of the additions (fortunately not the
original part). I have no ulterior motive I can assure you.
You are aware that I stepped into the ma'al of the
Finlay versus Reed Common controvercy & vowed
Id do what I could to stay the feud with honor for
all. The Cubans want (?) to visualize Lazear &
we wasn't imitate them by stressing their mistake in
the Camp Site. I had hoped to keep most of this
secret (or at least confidential) from Dr Ramos until
I had the plan all fool-proof & the bldg absolutely
certified to my satisfaction. I was going to called
some money to restore it, paying for the bldg and/or
its replacement myself as my own constutution to start
the ball rolling. Then & not till then I was going to
make certain specific suggestions to Ramos &
offer to give her the bldg restored etc to be used
perhaps as part of their “Lazear memorial” on the
site of their choice (perhaps) - that is, on the site where
3
Lazear died. However that matter was to be decided later. I hope
that Moran won't push the matter any more, yet. Please discuss
it with him at U of Va of you Y Fer fo.. I thought this was a
most fortunate discovery & that a group of Americans
could work the thing up & give it to Cuba as a token
of appreciation 1) as the place where the concept of
Finlay was proved correct of the work of the U S
any common 2) as a token of our appreciation
that Cuba thought so much of Lazear et al.
He could have an appropriate love feast using
the shack etc as a viable token & symbol & all
bury the batchet. It was my idea to get the bldg
legally (tentatively) protected in my hands now,
then form a small advisory committee (you among
them) to investigate our findings & approve our plan,
to keep us out aduse & prestige - & then when
all was set I'd write some friends here & there, friends of mine,
friends of Reeds, Lazear et al, and the Deans of the
various medical schools & hospital (including the Rockefeller) which pride themselves
on them having educated there over. If we couldn't
raise 2 or 3000 or so of private subscription (letters &
some interviews) I miss my guess. If we could get enough
not only to restore it (& move it perhaps) but also to build a nice
small one & 1/2 storey spanish type of bungalow to
enclose the bldg & protect it, with perhaps a small
museum on one side & rest rooms (?) on one side
& have it placed in an appropriate part of the
Cuban memorial group I think that would be
very nice.

In the museum we could slowly get souvenirs of Finlay, Reed
Lazear et al., perhaps an appropriate bronze tablet or
painting etc; photographs, photostats of Rojas day book,
maps identifying original location, copies of the old
any photos, replace of the Finlay medal, the
Congressional medal etc.

I should think the whole thing could be done quietly
& semi-privately with the names of a half dozen
of you who have loved Reed et al & know the value of
their work, your names but to us as an advisory
committee & to assure those we or I approach of
my sincerity & interest & the authenticity of our
investigations (of which you would have to assure
yourselves just to your complete satisfaction.
Perhaps Gen Truby & you, Gen Reed, Mrs. If the
collections were small & slow I'd merely have an
account here in a separate bank. If we really got
somewhere - enough even as an answer contribution
toward their memorial we'd have a bonded Treasurer
etc. Perhaps I am away ahead of myself - in fact
I know I am. Im merely thinking out loud
& putting confidentially on paper what I'd not meant
to discuss until the property was S A F E in interested
hands. Id appreciate hearing your comments at
your leisure either before or after you see Moran.
(Wed certainly let Dr Cooke, Mrs Lazear, Gen Reed etc
know what were up to let I think theyd applaud
our efforts don't you?
